posts.name: bobbysq
posts.cooked:
Since 2020, certain brands of brushless motors have enjoyed features that other brands have not implemented. Today, I have made progress towards closing that gap.

https://i.imgur.com/tZrPSsc.mp4

MicroPython code: nidecMario.py (3.2 KB)

White wire connects to pin 17, blue wire connects to pin 19. This should fit nicely together, except for the red wire hanging off of the side.

I hope this can finally bring the featuresets of legal brushless motors closer together. If anyone else does anything with this, feel free to share it here!

posts.name: bobbysq
posts.cooked:
Update: Support has been added for CHRP format files!

https://files.catbox.moe/m0vuof.mp4

Here’s the MicroPython code powering this - note that there’s two functions, “play_chrp” and “play_chrp_directly”. The former uses a library to read files that only works on songs that aren’t too long, otherwise the Pico runs out of memory. The latter reads files as they’re being played, which shouldn’t have any memory issues.

And here’s the stand-alone Python library I wrote for reading CHRP files! Hopefully it can be useful in the upcoming season, especially with the game’s theme and the addition of Python as an official programming language!

Contribute to bobbysq/chrpy development by creating an account on GitHub.
